title: Print, "Gathering Berries, from Harper's Weekly, July 11, 1874, p. 584", 1874
medium:
Wood engraving on off-white wove paper
Support: paper
signed:
Signed on block, lower right: W.H.
Signed on block, lower left: Lagarde Sc
inscribed: Caption: GATHERING BERRIES. - (DRAWN BY WINSLOW HOMER.)
creditline: Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.
description: Young girls and boys picking berries on the shore of a lake.  The children are not interacting with each other.  Five children are on the ground picking berries, while two girls on the right are standing up, one watches the other children while the other looks at the ground(?).  This scene is possibly located in East Hampton, Long Island(?).  Information from: Ferber, Linda S., Barbara Dayer Gallati and Marilyn S. Kushner, Winslow Homer: Illustrating America (New York: George Braziller in association with Brooklyn Museum of Art, 2000), p. 86.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Gathering Berries, from Harper's Weekly, July 11, 1874, p. 584", 1874.
1874. Wood engraving on off-white wove paper
Support: paper. Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.. 1947-4-21.
